name: World Cup 2002: Group H Quiz | FIFA World Cup | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Japan won the group by remaining unbeaten with two wins and a draw in front of their esctatic home fans.

questions.text: Japan vs Belgium: The game finished 2-2, but who scored the goals for Belgium?
questions.correct: Marc Wilmots & Peter Van Der Heyden
options: Nico Van Kerckhoven & Eric Van Meir
questions.explanation:
Marc Wilmots & Peter Van Der Heyden.

	Takayuki Suzuki and Junichi Inamoto scored Japan's goals in a game that was scoreless until the 59th minute.

questions.text: Russia vs Tunisia: What was the final score in this match?
questions.explanation:
Russia 2 Tunisia 0.

	Egor Titov put Russia ahead in the 59th minute and Valery Karpin doubled their lead five minutes later.

questions.text: Japan vs Russia: What was the significance of the outcome of this game?
questions.correct: First victory for Japan in World Cup Finals history
options: First goal for Junichi Inamoto in a Japanese shirt
First time a team had four players sent-off during the game
First time Russia had lost in a group phase match
questions.explanation:
First victory for Japan in World Cup Finals history.

	Inamoto scored in the 51st minute to send the co-hosts fans wild and parties ensued through the night.

questions.text: Tunisia vs Belgium: The score was 1-1, but who got the goals for each team?
questions.explanation:
Raouf Bouzaiene (Tunisia) & Marc Wilmots (Belgium).

	Wilmots put Belgium ahead in the 13th minute only for Bouzaiene to level the score with a thunderous free-kick four minutes later.

questions.text: Tunisia vs Japan: What was the score at half-time in this game?
questions.explanation:
Tunisia 0 Japan 0.

	Hiroaki Morishima scored in the 48th minute to give Japan the lead, and Hidetoshi Nakata doubled their advantage in the 75th to send the co-hosts through to the second round.

questions.text: Belgium vs Russia: How many goals were scored in this match?
questions.explanation:
5.

	The game finished 3-2 to Belgium, who led 1-0 at half-time.

questions.text: Belgium vs Russia: Who scored the only goal of the first half?
questions.explanation:
Johan Walem (Belgium).

	Walem scored in the 7th minute, Beschasntykh levelled for Russia in the 52nd, Sonck put Belgium 2-1 ahead in the 78th and Wilmots made it 3-1 four minutes later and finally, Sychev scored Russia's second in the 88th minute.

questions.text: Who did Japan go on to meet in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Turkey.

	Japan would go on to lose to Turkey in the second round with a 12th minute goal by Umit Davala, much to the disappointment of the home support.

questions.text: Who did Belgium, as runners-up of the group, go on to meet in the second round?
questions.explanation:
Brazil.

	Belgium would lose to Brazil in the second round, with a goal each for Rivaldo and Ronaldo.
